sect1.title: Summary
sect1.para: OCD and OC-related disorders are psychiatric conditions that lead to significant distress and functional impairment in multiple domains. In clinical practice and healthcare settings, it is important that providers accurately diagnose these conditions to ensure that patients receive adequate care. There are several challenges associated with diagnosing these conditions, including diverse presentation of symptoms, symptom overlap, comorbid conditions, and low patient insight. It is critical that providers use evidence-based assessment tools when conducting diagnostic interviews with these patients. This chapter provides information on common clinician-administered interviews, as well as other assessment measures that can assist clinicians with gathering clinical information. Further, a case illustration demonstrates how an unstructured clinical interview can be guided by structured assessment tools to help diagnose OCD. We also highlight important diversity factors to consider, along with dos and don’ts when interviewing and assessing for OCD and related disorders. Overall, this chapter can be used as a resource for providers across different settings to help them obtain an accurate and informed diagnosis of OCD and related disorders.
